page.title: 01THE SURVEY AREA - GENERAL
page.content: MOST OF THE AREA WITHIN THE GIVEN GRID REFERENCE CONSISTS OF AGRICULTURAL LAND, FARMED BY LOCAL OWNERS OR TENANT FARMERS. SOME OF THE LAND IS WORKED BY FARMERS WHO LIVE IN VILLAGES SITUATED IN SQUARES WHICH ARE ADJACENT TO OUR GRID REFERENCE AND WHO CONSEQUENTLY WERE NOT INTERVIEWED BY US. THE LANDSCAPE UNDULATES, FORMING A NATURAL VALLEY IN WHICH IS SITUATED PITSFORD RESERVOIR FORMED BY THE CONSTRUCTION OF AN EARTH-FILLED DAM. THE SOLE CENTRE OF POPULATION IN THE DESIGNATED AREA IS THE VILLAGE OF PITSFORD, BUILT ON THE CREST OF THE HILL. THE SITE OF THE ORIGINAL VILLAGE AS RECORDED IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK IS A LITTLE LOWER DOWN THE HILL WHERE A TOLL-GATE COTTAGE IS THE SOLE SURVIVOR OF THE FREQUENT FLOODS WHICH PROMPTED THE CHANGE OF LOCATION TO A MORE SENSIBLE SITUATION IN THE 17TH CENTURY.
